message: I'm doing an introduction to Rails talk and have committed each step as a tag in a git repo (https://github.com/yegrb/buildnight). I'd like to be able to checkout a tag and have it restore the entire contents of my directory, removing untracked/changed files. What's the best way to do this? I tried `rm -rf ; git checkout -f step_1` but it seems like there may be a better way to do this. Any suggestions?

It seems if you commit a file, file1, after tag1, create tag2, and reset --hard to tag1, that file will be removed.  You can reset to tag2, however file1 will not be restored, and `git status` will show file1 as being deleted.  Probably not what you want to do
`git reset --hard <tag>` should do what you want, though if the file(s) are untracked it wont affect them
